column4: anyone know if 6.10 will support higher resolutions in an upcoming update?
the resolutions you can use is dependant on you graphics driver. not ubuntu
if you are just getting xga, you might be using vesa drivers. change that :)
im running nvidia drivers...i think ^^
'sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx && sudo nvidia-glx-config'
yeah
if the last part doesnt work, run 'sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg' and select driver 'nvidia'
then rerun 'nvidia-glx-config
just cut and paste the commands :)
well, everything seems to be ok. running xgl and all, its just that i cant change my res higher then 1024x768
tried sud dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg but doesnt work
try 'lsmod | grep nvidia'
what does it say?
then i find it strange that you arent gett higher resolutions. have you checked your xorg.conf?
youll be looking for screen resolutions :)
they should be under the screen section
'sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf' <- in aterminal
scroll down to the screen section and add the resolutions you want under modes under the subsection 'display' for all color depths
weird. there are higher resolutions there but i still cant select them in prefs.
but i suspect something isnt right in that file... problem is i dont know what
use pastebin and link it. perhaps someone will be able to spot something
sry pastebin? :) and link it where?
the standard is se :)
